prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a large, rounded, metallic object with a flat base** 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin of the CAD space. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0188]. 2. Create the first face of the sketch. It will be a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. 3. Create a second face of the sketch. This will also be a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.345. 4. Create a third face of the sketch. This will be a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.315. 5. Scale the sketch by 0.75. 6. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by 0.0094 and in the opposite direction by 0.0094. This will create the first part of the CAD model. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section** 1. Create a new coordinate system at [0.03, 0.03, 0.0188] with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Create the first face of the sketch. It will be a circle with a center at [0.345, 0.345] and a radius of 0.345. 3. Create a second face of the sketch. This will be a circle with a center at [0.345, 0.345] and a radius of 0.315. 4.
